content.user_title: Master async Python with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Async code can be hard to reason about and easy to block. This skill provides clear patterns and examples for safe, fast asyncio design.
actual_capabilities: Explain the asyncio event loop, coroutines, tasks, and futures
Show concurrent execution with gather and task creation
Provide patterns for timeouts, error handling, and cancellation
Describe async context managers and async iterators
Outline rate limiting, producer consumer, and async locks
limitations: Does not run code or benchmark performance
Examples are illustrative and may need adaptation to frameworks
Does not install dependencies or set up environments
No automated review of your project security

prompt_templates.title: Concurrent fetching

prompt_templates.title: Robust pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a producer consumer async queue pattern with shutdown and cancellation handling.

output_examples.input: Give me a checklist for safe async task cancellation
output: Use try and except asyncio.CancelledError in long running tasks
Release locks and close connections in the cancellation handler
Re raise cancellation after cleanup to propagate shutdown
Use timeouts to prevent hung tasks during shutdown

best_practices: Use asyncio.run as the entry point for new programs
Always await coroutines and handle exceptions explicitly
Use timeouts and semaphores to control resource use
anti_patterns: Calling blocking functions inside async code
Creating tasks without awaiting or tracking them

faq.question: Is this compatible with Python 3.7 and newer
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance targets asyncio features available in Python 3.7 and later.

faq.question: What are the limits of the skill
faq.answer: It provides patterns and examples but does not execute code or validate runtime performance.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with FastAPI or aiohttp
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns apply to common async frameworks and I O libraries.

faq.question: Does it access my data or files
faq.answer: No, it is static guidance and does not read files or send network data.

faq.question: What should I do if async tasks hang
faq.answer: Add timeouts, instrument task states, and review blocking calls in the event loop.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic Python tips
faq.answer: It focuses on asyncio specific patterns like gather, semaphores, and cancellation.
